fr.sylfrey.misTiGriD.layout

Interface Layout

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AtmosphereLayout, HeaterLayout, HeaterManagerLayout, LampLayout, LampManagerLayout, LoadManagerLayout, OpeningLayout, ProsumerLayout, StorageLayout, ThermicObjectLayout
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AtmosphereLayoutImpl, HeaterLayoutImpl, HeaterManagerLayoutImpl, LampLayoutImpl, LampManagerLayoutImpl, LoadManagerLayoutImpl, ProsumerLayoutImpl, StorageLayoutImpl, ThermicObjectLayoutImpl, WallLayoutImpl

    public interface Layout
    Describes a two-dimensional rectangular object of size (width,height) at position (x,y). Stacking overlapping Layouts depend on their layer attribute: the higher the layer, the higher the Layout is in a stack. Note: usually, the (x,y) axis follow screen display convention: (0,0) is the top left corner, x axis to the right, y axis to the bottom. Note: the size unit is arbitrary: it might be in pixels, meters, etc.
    Author:
    syl

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int height() 
      int layer() 
      String name() 
      int width() 
      int x() 
      int y() 

    • Method Detail

      • name

        String name()
        Returns:
        unique identifier of this Layout

      • x

        int x()
        Returns:
        abscissa, from left to right, of the top left corner of this Layout.

      • y

        int y()
        Returns:
        ordinate, from top to bottom, of the top left corner of this Layout.

      • width

        int width()
        Returns:
        width of this Layout; for instance, top-right corner's abscissa is this.x() + this.width().

      • height

        int height()
        Returns:
        height of this Layout; for instance, bottom corner's ordinate is this.y() + this.height().

      • layer

        int layer()
        Returns:
        the layer on which to display this Layout; considering Layouts l1 and l2 with l1.layer() > l2.layer(), l1 will be displayed above l2.
